TunableVariant.name: end_of_gig_notification_icon_override
TunableVariant.display: End Of Gig Notification Icon Override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, allows tuning an icon override for the primary icon used in the End Of Gig Notification. If this is disabled, the icon tuned on the career track will be used.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The icon image to be displayed.

TunableVariant.name: end_of_gig_notifications
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, a notification to show at the end of the gig instead of a normal career message. Tokens are: * 0: The Sim owner of the career * 1: The level name (e.g. Chef) * 2: The career name (e.g. Culinary) * 3: The company name (e.g. Maids United) * 4: The pay for the gig * 5: The gratuity for the gig * 6: The customer (sim) of the gig, if there is a customer. * 7: A bullet list of loots and payments as a result of this gig. This list uses the text tuned on the loots themselves to create bullets for each loot. Those texts will generally have tokens 0 and 1 be the subject and target sims (of the loot) but may have additional tokens depending on the type of loot.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A map between the result type of the gig and the post-gig notification.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: A dialog that is displayed as a notification.

TunableVariant.name: additional_texts
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, add additional text to the dialog

Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

Tunable.name: anonymous_target_sim
Tunable.description: DEPRECATED! Please use custom_mask_target_sim instead. Use InGame/UI/Icons/Dialog/phone_anonymous_caller_icon.png and UI/Gameplay/Phone:UnknownCallerName. If this dialog is using a target sim id to give a conversation type view and this is checked, then the target sim icon will instead be replaced by an anonymous caller.

Tunable.name: immediate_audio
Tunable.description: If checked, this audio will be triggered immediately, nothing will block. ex. Earbuds audio will be played immediately while the Sim is routing or animating.

Tunable.description: The name of the slot this audio is attached to.

Tunable.name: play_on_active_sim_only
Tunable.description: If enabled, and audio target is Sim, the audio will only be played on selected Sim. Otherwise it will be played regardless Sim is selected or not. If audio target is Object, always set this to False. Otherwise the audio will never be played. ex. This will be useful for Earbuds where we want to hear the music only when the Sim is selected.

TunableVariant.description: If tuned, the notification that will be used if the sim gains an overmax level during this gig. Will override the overmax notification in career messages. The following tokens are provided: * 0: The Sim owner of the career * 1: The level name (e.g. Chef) * 2: The career name (e.g. Culinary) * 3: The company name (e.g. Maids United) * 4: The overmax level * 5: The pay for the gig * 6: Additional pay tuned at additional_pay_per_overmax_level * 7: The overmax rewards in a bullet-point list, in the form of a string. These are tuned on the career_track

TunableVariant.description: If tuned, the notification that will be used if the sim gains an overmax level with no reward during this gig. Will override the overmax rewardless notification in career messages.The following tokens are provided: * 0: The Sim owner of the career * 1: The level name (e.g. Chef) * 2: The career name (e.g. Culinary) * 3: The company name (e.g. Maids United) * 4: The overmax level * 5: The pay for the gig * 6: Additional pay tuned at additional_pay_per_overmax_level

If this dialog is using a target sim id to give a conversation type view and this is checked, then the target sim icon will instead be replaced by an anonymous caller.

TunableVariant.name: extend_duration_by_situation_tag
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, when a gig ends, extend the gig's duration by adding the remaining duration of the running situation based on situation tags. Example: The interior decorator gig lasts from 9 AM to 9 PM, but when the reveal situation is running and we hit the original end time, we don't want to end the gig until that reveal situation times out. [jsampson]

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: Tag set for arbitrary groupings of situation types.

TunableEnum.description: Situation tag.

TunableVariant.name: follow_up_gig
TunableVariant.description: If enabled and the current gig is successfully completed, the follow-up gig will be automatically set on the Sim when the current gig is removed. A couple things to note: - The scheduled time will be the time the follow-up gig is added to the Sim plus any prep time. - If the current gig has a customer, the follow-up gig will have the same customer.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The follow-up gig to push on the Sim.

TunableList.name: gig_cast
TunableList.description: This is the list of sims that need to spawn for this gig.

TunableTuple.description: Data for cast members. It contains a test which tests against the owner of this gig and spawn the necessary sims. A bit may be applied through the loot action to determine the type of cast members (costars, directors, etc...)

TunableVariant.name: cast_member_rel_bit
TunableVariant.description: If tuned, this rel bit will be applied on the spawned cast member.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: Rel bit to apply.

Tunable.name: sim_filter
Tunable.description: If filter test is passed, this sim is created and stored.

TunableEnum.name: gig_cast_rel_bit_collection_id
TunableEnum.display: Gig Cast Rel Bit Collection Id
TunableEnum.description: If a rel bit is applied to the cast member, it must be of this collection id. We use this to clear the rel bit when the gig is over.

TunableVariant.name: gig_pay
TunableVariant.description: Base amount of pay for this gig. Can be either a flat amount or a range.

TunableTuple.name: flat_amount
TunableTuple.description: A literal value that is to be used as the lower and upper bound of an interval. This allows both literal and range interval tunings in the same TunableVariant without having to manually set the lower and upper bounds to the same value.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The upper and lower bounds.

TunableTuple.name: range
TunableTuple.description: A tunable interval between lower_bound and upper_bound.

Tunable.name: lower_bound
Tunable.description: The lower bound of the interval.

Tunable.name: upper_bound
Tunable.description: The upper bound of the interval.

TunableVariant.name: gig_pay_currency
TunableVariant.description: Allows tuning either Simoleons or Bucks as the payment currency for this Gig.

TunableEnum.name: Bucks
TunableEnum.description: The type of Buck to use to pay out this Gig.

TunableList.name: gig_prep_tasks
TunableList.description: A list of prep tasks the Sim can do to improve their performance during the gig.

TunableTuple.description: Tuple containing the necessary data to display the progress of the prep task to the UI.

TunableList.name: linked_statistics
TunableList.description: If specified, these are statistics whose value updates are linked to the specified statistic. Value changes to the linked statistic are applied with the tuned multiplier to the statistic.

Tunable.name: statistic
Tunable.description: Statistic that is tracked by this prep task.

Tunable.name: task_description
Tunable.description: A description of the prep task. {0.String} is the thresholded description.

Tunable.name: task_icon
Tunable.description: The icon to use in displaying the prep task.

TunableVariant.name: task_tooltip
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, tooltip will show up on the preptask.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A tooltip of the prep task.

TunableList.name: thresholded_descriptions
TunableList.description: A list of thresholds and the text describing it. The thresholded description will be largest threshold value in this list that the commodity is >= to.

Tunable.name: text
Tunable.description: Description for meeting this threshold.

Tunable.name: threshold
Tunable.description: Threshold that the commodity must >= to.

TunableTuple.name: gig_prep_time
TunableTuple.description: The amount of time between when a gig is selected and when it occurs.

Tunable.name: days
Tunable.description: Number of days

Tunable.name: hours
Tunable.description: Number of hours

Tunable.name: minutes
Tunable.description: Number of minutes

TunableTuple.name: gig_time
TunableTuple.description: A tunable schedule that will determine when you have to be at work.

TunableList.name: schedule_entries
TunableList.description: A list of event schedules. Each event is a mapping of days of the week to a start_time and duration.

TunableTuple.description: A schedule. Define availability for days of the week. For the set of specified days, define an hour of the day and a duration, in hours. Optionally, specified if the start time is random within the tuned window.

TunableTuple.name: days_available
TunableTuple.description: Which days of the week to include

Tunable.name: duration
Tunable.description: Duration of this work session in hours.

Tunable.name: random_start
Tunable.description: If checked, this schedule will have a random start time in the tuned window each time.

TunableEnum.name: schedule_shift_type
TunableEnum.description: Shift Type for the schedule, this will be used for validations.

TunableTuple.name: start_time
TunableTuple.description: An Hour(24Hr) and Minute representing a time relative to the beginning of a day.

Tunable.name: hour
Tunable.description: Hour of the day

Tunable.name: minute
Tunable.description: Minute of Hour

TunableVariant.name: initial_result_based_career_performance
TunableVariant.description: A mapping between the GigResult for this gig and the initial career performance for the Sim's first gig.

TunableList.name: enabled
TunableList.description: A map between the result type of the gig and the initial career performance the Sim will receive.

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: The GigResult enum that represents the outcome of the Gig.

Tunable.name: value
Tunable.description: The initial performance value that will be applied.

TunableList.name: loots_on_schedule
TunableList.description: Loot actions to apply when a sim gets a gig.

TunableVariant.name: odd_job_tuning
TunableVariant.description: Tuning specific to odd jobs. Leave untuned if this gig is not an odd job.

Tunable.name: customer_description
Tunable.description: The description of the odd job written by the customer. Token 0 is the customer sim.

TunableVariant.name: gig_gratuity_bullet_point_text
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, the gig gratuity will be a bullet point in the bullet pointed list of loots and money supplied to the end of gig notification (this is token 7 of that notification). If disabled, gratuity will be omitted from that list. Tokens: * 0: The sim owner of the career * 1: The customer * 2: the gratuity amount

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: A localized string that may use tokens.

TunableList.name: result_based_gig_gratuity_chance_multipliers
TunableList.display: Result Based Gig Gratuity Chance Multipliers
TunableList.description: A set of multipliers for determining the gig gratuity chance (i.e., the probability the Sim will receive gratuity in addition to the base pay). The gratuity chance depends on the GigResult of the gig. This maps the result type of the gig and the gratuity chance/percentage. If this map (or a GigResult) is left untuned, then no gratuity is added.

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: The GigResult enum that represents the outcome of the Gig.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: The multiplier to be calculated for this GigResult. This represents the percentage chance the Sim will receive gratuity. If the Sim is to not receive gratuity, the base value should be 0 (without further tests). If this Sim is guaranteed to receive gratuity, the base value should be 1 (without further tests).

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableList.name: result_based_gig_gratuity_multipliers
TunableList.description: A set of multipliers for the gig gratuity. This maps the result type of the gig and the gratuity multiplier (a percentage). The base pay will be multiplied by this multiplier in order to determine the actual gratuity amount.

TunableEnum.name: key
TunableEnum.description: The GigResult enum that represents the outcome of the Gig.

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: The gratuity multiplier to be calculated for this GigResult.

Tunable.name: base_value
Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

Tunable.name: use_customer_description_as_gig_description
Tunable.display: Use Customer Description As Gig Description
Tunable.description: If checked, the customer description will be used as the gig description. This description is used as the tooltip for the gig icon in the career panel.

TunableEnum.name: on_pick_behavior
TunableEnum.description: Determines what happens to this Gig if it is picked in a picker.

Tunable.name: open_career_panel
Tunable.description: If set to true, the career panel will be opened when this gig is assigned.

TunableTuple.name: value

Tunable.name: base_amount

TunableTuple.name: value
TunableTuple.description: Mulitiplier on statistic payout if scorable situation ends with the associate medal.

Tunable.description: The basic value to return if no modifications are applied.

TunableList.name: multipliers
TunableList.description: A list of multipliers to apply to base_value.

Tunable.name: multiplier
Tunable.description: The multiplier to apply to base_value if the associated tests pass.

TdescFragTag.name: tests
TdescFragTag.description: A series of tests that must pass in order for multiplier to be applied.

TunableList.name: ui_threshold
TunableList.description: Thresholds and icons we use for this stat to display in the end of day dialog. Tune in reverse of highest threshold to lowest threshold.

TunableTuple.description: Threshold and icon for this stat and this gig.

Tunable.name: threshold
Tunable.description: Threshold that the stat must >= to.

Tunable.name: threshold_description
Tunable.description: Description to use with icon

Tunable.name: threshold_icon
Tunable.description: Icon if the stat is of this threshold.

TunableVariant.name: picker_associated_sim_filter
TunableVariant.description: If tuned, this will associate a Sim with this Gig in a gig picker.

TunableVariant.name: picker_associated_sim_name_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled and tuned, this string will be used for the name of the associated Sim.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The string to use in place of the associated Sim's name. This is currently only supported by Mission Gigs.

TunableVariant.name: picker_associated_sim_thumbnail_background

TunableVariant.name: picker_associated_sim_thumbnail_override
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, an override thumbnail can be used in place of the tuned Picker Associated Sim Filter.

Tunable.name: enabled
Tunable.description: The image to use for the Associated Sim's thumbnail.

Tunable.name: picker_disable_if_visibility_tests_fail_with_tooltip
Tunable.display: Picker Disable If Visibility Tests Fail With Tooltip
Tunable.description: If checked, when the Visibility Tests fail and a tooltip is provided, this Gig will show in the picker but be disabled. This tuning works independently of the Disable Row If Visibility Tests Fail tunable in GigPickerInteraction.

Tunable.name: picker_replace_if_removed
Tunable.description: If checked, whenever we remove this Gig because it was selected in a picker, we will replace it with a new valid Gig from the same bucket.

TunableVariant.name: picker_scheduling_behavior
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this defines the behavior for a Gig in a GigPickerInteraction.

TunableVariant.name: enabled
TunableVariant.description: The action that will be performed when this Gig is selected and scheduled from a gig picker.

TunableTuple.name: schedule_career_gig
TunableTuple.description: Schedule this gig directly should the player pick this to run.

Tunable.name: allow_add_career
Tunable.description: If tuned, picking this Gig will add the required career if the Sim doesn't already have it. If not tuned, trying to add a gig for a career the sim doesn't have will throw an error.

TunableTuple.name: schedule_drama_node
TunableTuple.description: Drama node to schedule should the player pick this to run.

Tunable.name: drama_node
Tunable.description: Drama node to schedule.

TunableVariant.name: picker_scoring
TunableVariant.description: If enabled, this Gig will be scored and chosen by a GigPickerInteraction. If there are multiple Gigs in the same scoring bucket, they will be scored relative to each other.

Tunable.name: base_score
Tunable.description: The base score of this Gig.

TunableEnum.name: bucket
TunableEnum.description: Which scoring bucket should this Gig be scored in. Only Gigs in the same bucket are scored against each other. Change different bucket settings within the Career module tuning.

TdescFragTag.name: picker_visibility_tests
TdescFragTag.description: Tests that will be run on the picker owner of this gig to determine if this gig should appear in a picker.
